meanings.definition: The role or position of a tutor.
meanings.sent1: In the school play, I played the tutorship of the wise old teacher.
meanings.sent2: Her tutorship at the university involves helping students with their assignments.
meanings.sent3: The cat took on the tutorship of teaching the new kitten how to catch mice.
meanings.sent4: The tutorship of the sun over the sky was evident as it slowly set in the west.
meanings.sent5: The tutorship of the captain on the ship ensured everyone followed the rules.

meanings.definition: The act of tutoring or providing instruction.
meanings.sent1: During the summer, she offered tutorship to children struggling with math.
meanings.sent2: His tutorship of the young musicians helped them improve their skills.
meanings.sent3: The clown's tutorship on juggling was both entertaining and informative.
meanings.sent4: The tutorship of the chef in the kitchen was like watching a master at work.
meanings.sent5: The tutorship of the coach on the field motivated the players to do their best.

meanings.definition: The state of being under the guidance or supervision of a tutor.
meanings.sent1: The student appreciated the tutorship provided during exam preparation.
meanings.sent2: Being in tutorship has helped her understand complex subjects better.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was in tutorship and learning how to behave around other dogs.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed beautifully under the tutorship of the skilled gardener.
meanings.sent5: The artist's tutorship brought out the hidden talent in the aspiring painter.
